results.title: Journey into time
results.brief_description: Presents an animated overview of the earth’s five great geological eras. Depicts one theory of the earth’s origin, its primeval state, transformation from a fiery ball to an inhabitable globe, and the predominant forms of life throughout geological time. Narrated by Gilbert Mack. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: Journey back
results.brief_description: Dramatised account of the rehabilitation of a hemiplegic patient. Deals with the cause and extent of paralysis and demonstrates the work of physical, occupational, recreational and speech therapists and their contribution to the recovery of the patient.

results.title: Joseph Schultz
results.brief_description: A young German soldier refuses to fire on a line of Yugoslav partisans. His disobedience costs him his life. Based on an actual event in the Second World War, Joseph Schultz uses both realistic reconstruction and documentary evidence to assert the continuing resonance of resistance.
results.description: A young German soldier refuses to fire on a line of Yugoslav partisans. His disobedience costs him his life. results.title: Can we live to be 100?
results.creator_credit: Jonathan Donald, Isaac Kleinerman, James Jackson, Peter Poor and Columbia Broadcasting System
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “21st Century”.
At the National Institute of Health in Baltimore, researchers are trying to find answers to the question of extending life. Scientists are studying microscopic creatures called rotifers whose life span has been increased by a drastic change of environment. The possibility that this might be an effective program for human life is the problem posed in the survey. the film also discusses organ transplanting, germ-free isolation for patients, freezing the dead or incurable for possible revival and experiments on the aging process.
